messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Leslie Rice  To:  Sent: Thursday, March 06, 2003 12:57 PM Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom]
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Leslie Rice" <leslie@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 06, 2003 12:57 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fw: [Unschooling_Canada] Unschooling
Conferences


> I thought I'd pass this on!
>
> Leslie
>
> "The function of the child is to live his own life - not the life that his
anxious parents think he should live, nor a life according to the purpose of
the educator who thinks he knows what is best. All of this interference and
guidance on the part of adults only produces a generation of robots."
> A. S. Neill
>
> --------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------
>
> A post from unschooling_canada@yahoogroups.com :
>
>
> Hey, are there any unschooling conferences in Canada? They have really
> awesome ones in the States, and I am ever so jealous. Did anyone see
Sandra
> Dodd in Saskatoon? I wish I would have known. I would have gone.....
> Debi, freezing in Edmonton
>
>

messages.subject: Fw: [Unschooling_Canada] Unschooling Conferences
messages.msgSnippet: I thought I d pass this on! Leslie The function of the child is to live his own life - not the life that his anxious parents think he should live, nor a life
messages.messageBody:
I thought I'd pass this on!

Leslie

"The function of the child is to live his own life - not the life that his anxious parents think he should live, nor a life according to the purpose of the educator who thinks he knows what is best. All of this interference and guidance on the part of adults only produces a generation of robots."
A. S. Neill

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A post from unschooling_canada@yahoogroups.com :


Hey, are there any unschooling conferences in Canada? They have really
awesome ones in the States, and I am ever so jealous. Did anyone see Sandra
Dodd in Saskatoon? I wish I would have known. I would have gone.....
Debi, freezing in Edmonton
